title: 108_s269
content: The "Captive Wildlife Safety Act" defines prohibited wildlife species as live lions, tigers, leopards, cheetahs, jaguars, cougars, and hybrids of these species. It prohibits certain acts related to these species. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been updated to include any prohibited wildlife species, as defined by the Captive Wildlife Safety Act. This amendment expands the list of prohibited species and updates certain paragraphs within the Act. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been updated to include prohibited wildlife species defined by the Captive Wildlife Safety Act. This amendment expands the list of prohibited species and updates certain paragraphs within the Act, including exemptions for licensed exhibitors, research facilities, sanctuaries, humane societies, animal shelters, and societies for the prevention of cruelty to animals. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been updated to include prohibited wildlife species defined by the Captive Wildlife Safety Act. The amendments include exemptions for licensed exhibitors, research facilities, sanctuaries, humane societies, animal shelters, and societies for the prevention of cruelty to animals. These exemptions specify that entities must not engage in commercial trade of listed animals, propagate animals in their facilities, or allow unescorted public visitation or direct contact with wild animals. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been updated to include prohibited wildlife species defined by the Captive Wildlife Safety Act. Exemptions are provided for licensed exhibitors, research facilities, sanctuaries, humane societies, animal shelters, and societies for the prevention of cruelty to animals. These exemptions specify that entities must not engage in commercial trade of listed animals, propagate animals in their facilities, or allow unescorted public visitation or direct contact with wild animals. Additionally, certain individuals and entities are allowed to handle wild animals for specific purposes, such as transportation or exhibition. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been updated to include prohibited wildlife species defined by the Captive Wildlife Safety Act. Regulations will be promulgated to describe the entities affected by these amendments, and state authority to regulate wildlife species is preserved. The application of these amendments will begin upon the effective date of the regulations. The Senate passed S. 269 on October 31, 2003, amending the Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 to enhance the conservation of certain wildlife species.
